trans-unit.source: Add push notifications to your Xamarin.Forms app
trans-unit.target: Add push notifications to your Xamarin.Forms app

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services to send push notifications to the iOS, Android, and Windows Phone app of your Xamarin.Forms solution.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services to send push notifications to the iOS, Android, and Windows Phone app of your Xamarin.Forms solution.

trans-unit.source: Start by creating a mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Start by creating a mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Then, you'll download a starter sample, register with the appropriate push notification services, and add code to the solution to receive notifications from those services.
trans-unit.target: Then, you'll download a starter sample, register with the appropriate push notification services, and add code to the solution to receive notifications from those services.

trans-unit.source: When you complete this tutorial, your mobile service will send a push notification each time a user adds a task in one of the apps.
trans-unit.target: When you complete this tutorial, your mobile service will send a push notification each time a user adds a task in one of the apps.

trans-unit.source: You can find the completed sample here: [Completed Xamarin.Forms Azure Push Notification Sample].
trans-unit.target: You can find the completed sample here: [Completed Xamarin.Forms Azure Push Notification Sample].

trans-unit.source: This tutorial requires the following:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial requires the following:

trans-unit.source: An iOS 8 device (you cannot test push notifications in the iOS Simulator)
trans-unit.target: An iOS 8 device (you cannot test push notifications in the iOS Simulator)

trans-unit.source: iOS Developer Program membership
trans-unit.target: iOS Developer Program membership

trans-unit.source: [Xamarin.iOS Studio]
trans-unit.target: [Xamarin.iOS Studio]

trans-unit.source: [Azure Mobile Services Component]
trans-unit.target: [Azure Mobile Services Component]

trans-unit.source: An active Google account
trans-unit.target: An active Google account

trans-unit.source: [Google Cloud Messaging Client Component].
trans-unit.target: [Google Cloud Messaging Client Component].

trans-unit.source: You will add this component during the tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You will add this component during the tutorial.

trans-unit.source: In this topic:
trans-unit.target: In this topic:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Create a New Mobile Service</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Create a New Mobile Service</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Download and Configure the Starter Sample</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Add push notifications to your Xamarin.Forms.iOS app</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Add push notifications to your Xamarin.Forms.Android app</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Add push notifications to your Xamarin.Forms.Windows app</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Add push notifications to your Xamarin.Forms.Windows app</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Update Azure table insert script to send push notifications to all apps</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Update Azure table insert script to send push notifications to all apps</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Create a New Mobile Service
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Create a New Mobile Service

trans-unit.source: To be able to store app data in the new mobile service, you must first create a new table.
trans-unit.target: To be able to store app data in the new mobile service, you must first create a new table.

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, click Mobile Services, and then click the mobile service that you just created.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, click Mobile Services, and then click the mobile service that you just created.

trans-unit.source: Click the Data tab, then click +Create.
trans-unit.target: Click the Data tab, then click +Create.

trans-unit.source: This displays the Create new table dialog.
trans-unit.target: This displays the Create new table dialog.

trans-unit.source: In Table name type TodoItem, then click the check button.
trans-unit.target: In Table name type TodoItem, then click the check button.

trans-unit.source: This creates a new storage table TodoItem with the default permissions set, which means that any user of the app can access and change data in the table.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new storage table TodoItem with the default permissions set, which means that any user of the app can access and change data in the table.

trans-unit.source: The same table name is used in Mobile Services quickstart.
trans-unit.target: The same table name is used in Mobile Services quickstart.

trans-unit.source: However, each table is created in a schema that is specific to a given mobile service.
trans-unit.target: However, each table is created in a schema that is specific to a given mobile service.

trans-unit.source: This is to prevent data collisions when multiple mobile services use the same database.
trans-unit.target: This is to prevent data collisions when multiple mobile services use the same database.

trans-unit.source: Click the new TodoItem table and verify that there are no data rows.
trans-unit.target: Click the new TodoItem table and verify that there are no data rows.

trans-unit.source: Click the Columns tab and verify that there is only a single id column, which is automatically created for you.
trans-unit.target: Click the Columns tab and verify that there is only a single id column, which is automatically created for you.

trans-unit.source: This is the minimum requirement for a table in Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: This is the minimum requirement for a table in Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: When dynamic schema is enabled on your mobile service, new columns are created automatically when JSON objects are sent to the mobile service by an insert or update operation.
trans-unit.target: When dynamic schema is enabled on your mobile service, new columns are created automatically when JSON objects are sent to the mobile service by an insert or update operation.

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to use the new mobile service as data storage for the app.
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to use the new mobile service as data storage for the app.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Download and Configure the Starter Sample
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Download and Configure the Starter Sample

trans-unit.source: We'll add push notifications to an existing sample.
trans-unit.target: We'll add push notifications to an existing sample.

trans-unit.source: Download the following sample: [Xamarin.Forms Azure Push Notification Starter Sample].
trans-unit.target: Download the following sample: [Xamarin.Forms Azure Push Notification Starter Sample].

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, click Mobile Services, and then click the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, click Mobile Services, and then click the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Click the Dashboard tab and make a note of the Site URL.
trans-unit.target: Click the Dashboard tab and make a note of the Site URL.

trans-unit.source: Then click Manage Keys and make a note of the Application Key.
trans-unit.target: Then click Manage Keys and make a note of the Application Key.

trans-unit.source: You'll need these values when you access the mobile service from your app code.
trans-unit.target: You'll need these values when you access the mobile service from your app code.

trans-unit.source: In the ToDoAzure(Portable) project of the solution, open the Constants.cs file, replace ApplicationURL and ApplicationKey with the site URL and application key you obtained in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: In the ToDoAzure(Portable) project of the solution, open the Constants.cs file, replace ApplicationURL and ApplicationKey with the site URL and application key you obtained in the previous step.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Add push notifications to your Xamarin.Forms.iOS app
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Add push notifications to your Xamarin.Forms.iOS app

trans-unit.source: You'll add push notifications to the iOS app by using the Apple Push Notification service (APNS).
trans-unit.target: You'll add push notifications to the iOS app by using the Apple Push Notification service (APNS).

trans-unit.source: You'll need an active Google account, and the [Google Cloud Messaging Client Component].
trans-unit.target: You'll need an active Google account, and the [Google Cloud Messaging Client Component].

trans-unit.source: Because of Apple Push Notification service (APNS) requirements, you must deploy and test push notifications on an iOS capable device (iPhone or iPad) instead of in the emulator.
trans-unit.target: Because of Apple Push Notification service (APNS) requirements, you must deploy and test push notifications on an iOS capable device (iPhone or iPad) instead of in the emulator.

trans-unit.source: APNS uses certificates to authenticate your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: APNS uses certificates to authenticate your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Follow these instructions to create the necessary certificates and upload it to your Mobile Service.
trans-unit.target: Follow these instructions to create the necessary certificates and upload it to your Mobile Service.

trans-unit.source: For the official APNS feature documentation, see [Apple Push Notification Service].
trans-unit.target: For the official APNS feature documentation, see [Apple Push Notification Service].

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Generate the Certificate Signing Request file
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Generate the Certificate Signing Request file

trans-unit.source: First you must generate the Certificate Signing Request (CSR) file, which is used by Apple to generate a signed certificate.
trans-unit.target: First you must generate the Certificate Signing Request (CSR) file, which is used by Apple to generate a signed certificate.

trans-unit.source: From Utilities, run the Keychain Access tool.
trans-unit.target: From Utilities, run the Keychain Access tool.

trans-unit.source: Click Keychain Access, expand Certificate Assistant, then click Request a Certificate from a Certificate Authority....
trans-unit.target: Click Keychain Access, expand Certificate Assistant, then click Request a Certificate from a Certificate Authority....

trans-unit.source: Enter your User Email Address, type in a Common Name value, make sure that Saved to disk is selected, and then click Continue.
trans-unit.target: Enter your User Email Address, type in a Common Name value, make sure that Saved to disk is selected, and then click Continue.

trans-unit.source: Type a name for the Certificate Signing Request (CSR) file in Save As, select the location in Where, then click Save.
trans-unit.target: Type a name for the Certificate Signing Request (CSR) file in Save As, select the location in Where, then click Save.

trans-unit.source: Remember the location you chose.
trans-unit.target: Remember the location you chose.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will register your app with Apple, enable push notifications, and upload this exported CSR to create a push certificate.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will register your app with Apple, enable push notifications, and upload this exported CSR to create a push certificate.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Register your app for push notifications
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Register your app for push notifications

trans-unit.source: To be able to send push notifications to an iOS app from mobile services, you must register your application with Apple and register for push notifications.
trans-unit.target: To be able to send push notifications to an iOS app from mobile services, you must register your application with Apple and register for push notifications.

trans-unit.source: If you have not already registered your app, navigate to the iOS Provisioning Portal at the Apple Developer Center, log on with your Apple ID, click Identifiers, then click App IDs, and finally click on the + sign to create an app ID for your app.
trans-unit.target: If you have not already registered your app, navigate to the iOS Provisioning Portal at the Apple Developer Center, log on with your Apple ID, click Identifiers, then click App IDs, and finally click on the + sign to create an app ID for your app.

trans-unit.source: Type a name for your app in Description, enter and remember the unique Bundle Identifier, check the "Push Notifications" option in the "App Services" section, and then click Continue.
trans-unit.target: Type a name for your app in Description, enter and remember the unique Bundle Identifier, check the "Push Notifications" option in the "App Services" section, and then click Continue.

trans-unit.source: This example uses the ID MobileServices.Quickstart but you may not reuse this same ID, as app IDs must be unique across all users.
trans-unit.target: This example uses the ID MobileServices.Quickstart but you may not reuse this same ID, as app IDs must be unique across all users.

trans-unit.source: As such, it is recommended that you append your full name or initials after the app name.
trans-unit.target: As such, it is recommended that you append your full name or initials after the app name.

trans-unit.source: This generates your app ID and requests you to Submit the information.
trans-unit.target: This generates your app ID and requests you to Submit the information.

trans-unit.source: Click Submit.
trans-unit.target: Click Submit.

trans-unit.source: Once you click Submit, you will see the Registration complete screen, as shown below.
trans-unit.target: Once you click Submit, you will see the Registration complete screen, as shown below.

trans-unit.source: Click Done.
trans-unit.target: Click Done.

trans-unit.source: Locate the app ID that you just created, and click on its row.
trans-unit.target: Locate the app ID that you just created, and click on its row.

trans-unit.source: Clicking on the app ID will display details on the app and app ID.
trans-unit.target: Clicking on the app ID will display details on the app and app ID.

trans-unit.source: Click the Settings button.
trans-unit.target: Click the Settings button.

trans-unit.source: Scroll to the bottom of the screen, and click the Create Certificate... button under the section Development Push SSL Certificate.
trans-unit.target: Scroll to the bottom of the screen, and click the Create Certificate... button under the section Development Push SSL Certificate.

trans-unit.source: This displays the "Add iOS Certificate" assistant.
trans-unit.target: This displays the "Add iOS Certificate" assistant.

trans-unit.source: Note: This tutorial uses a development certificate.
trans-unit.target: Note: This tutorial uses a development certificate.

trans-unit.source: The same process is used when registering a production certificate.
trans-unit.target: The same process is used when registering a production certificate.

trans-unit.source: Just make sure that you set the same certificate type when you upload the certificate to Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: Just make sure that you set the same certificate type when you upload the certificate to Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: Click Choose File, browse to the location where you saved the CSR file earlier, then click Generate.
trans-unit.target: Click Choose File, browse to the location where you saved the CSR file earlier, then click Generate.

trans-unit.source: After the certificate is created by the portal, click the Download button, and click Done.
trans-unit.target: After the certificate is created by the portal, click the Download button, and click Done.

trans-unit.source: This downloads the signing certificate and saves it to your computer in your Downloads folder.
trans-unit.target: This downloads the signing certificate and saves it to your computer in your Downloads folder.

trans-unit.source: Note: By default, the downloaded file a development certificate is named <html></html>aps_development.cer<html></html>.
trans-unit.target: Note: By default, the downloaded file a development certificate is named <html></html>aps_development.cer<html></html>.

trans-unit.source: Double-click the downloaded push certificate aps_development.cer.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the downloaded push certificate aps_development.cer.

trans-unit.source: This installs the new certificate in the Keychain, as shown below:
trans-unit.target: This installs the new certificate in the Keychain, as shown below:

trans-unit.source: Note: The name in your certificate might be different, but it will be prefixed with <html></html>Apple Development iOS Push Notification Services:<html></html>.
trans-unit.target: Note: The name in your certificate might be different, but it will be prefixed with <html></html>Apple Development iOS Push Notification Services:<html></html>.

trans-unit.source: Later, you will use this certificate to generate a .p12 file and upload it to Mobile Services to enable authentication with APNS.
trans-unit.target: Later, you will use this certificate to generate a .p12 file and upload it to Mobile Services to enable authentication with APNS.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Create a provisioning profile for the app
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Create a provisioning profile for the app

trans-unit.source: Back in the iOS Provisioning Portal, select Provisioning Profiles, select All, and then click the + button to create a new profile.
trans-unit.target: Back in the iOS Provisioning Portal, select Provisioning Profiles, select All, and then click the + button to create a new profile.

trans-unit.source: This launches the Add iOS Provisiong Profile Wizard.
trans-unit.target: This launches the Add iOS Provisiong Profile Wizard.

trans-unit.source: Select iOS App Development under Development as the provisiong profile type, and click Continue.
trans-unit.target: Select iOS App Development under Development as the provisiong profile type, and click Continue.

trans-unit.source: Next, select the app ID for the Mobile Services Quickstart app from the App ID drop-down list, and click Continue.
trans-unit.target: Next, select the app ID for the Mobile Services Quickstart app from the App ID drop-down list, and click Continue.

trans-unit.source: In the Select certificates screen, select the certificate created earlier, and click Continue.
trans-unit.target: In the Select certificates screen, select the certificate created earlier, and click Continue.

trans-unit.source: Next, select the Devices to use for testing, and click Continue.
trans-unit.target: Next, select the Devices to use for testing, and click Continue.

trans-unit.source: Finally, pick a name for the profile in Profile Name, click Generate, and click Done.
trans-unit.target: Finally, pick a name for the profile in Profile Name, click Generate, and click Done.

trans-unit.source: This creates a new provisioning profile.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new provisioning profile.

trans-unit.source: In Xcode, open the Organizer select the Devices view, select Provisioning Profiles in the Library section in the left pane, and then click the Refresh button at the bottom of the middle pane.
trans-unit.target: In Xcode, open the Organizer select the Devices view, select Provisioning Profiles in the Library section in the left pane, and then click the Refresh button at the bottom of the middle pane.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Configure Mobile Services to send push requests
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Configure Mobile Services to send push requests

trans-unit.source: After you have registered your app with APNS and configured your project, you must next configure your mobile service to integrate with APNS.
trans-unit.target: After you have registered your app with APNS and configured your project, you must next configure your mobile service to integrate with APNS.

trans-unit.source: In Keychain Access, right-click the new certificate, click Export, name your file, select the .p12 format, then click Save.
trans-unit.target: In Keychain Access, right-click the new certificate, click Export, name your file, select the .p12 format, then click Save.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of the file name and location of the exported certificate.
trans-unit.target: Make a note of the file name and location of the exported certificate.

trans-unit.source: Log on to the [Azure Management Portal], click Mobile Services, and then click your app.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the [Azure Management Portal], click Mobile Services, and then click your app.

trans-unit.source: Click the Push tab and click Upload under apple push notification settings.
trans-unit.target: Click the Push tab and click Upload under apple push notification settings.

trans-unit.source: This displays the Upload Certificate dialog.
trans-unit.target: This displays the Upload Certificate dialog.

trans-unit.source: Click File, select the exported certificate .p12 file, enter the Password, make sure that the correct Mode is selected, click the check icon, then click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click File, select the exported certificate .p12 file, enter the Password, make sure that the correct Mode is selected, click the check icon, then click Save.

trans-unit.source: Your mobile service is now configured to work with APNS.
trans-unit.target: Your mobile service is now configured to work with APNS.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Configure your Xamarin.iOS application
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Configure your Xamarin.iOS application

trans-unit.source: In Xamarin.Studio or Visual Studio, open Info.plist, and update the Bundle Identifier with the ID you created earlier.
trans-unit.target: In Xamarin.Studio or Visual Studio, open Info.plist, and update the Bundle Identifier with the ID you created earlier.

trans-unit.source: Scroll down to Background Modes and check the Enable Background Modes box and the Remote notifications box.
trans-unit.target: Scroll down to Background Modes and check the Enable Background Modes box and the Remote notifications box.

trans-unit.source: Double click your project in the Solution Panel to open Project Options.
trans-unit.target: Double click your project in the Solution Panel to open Project Options.

trans-unit.source: Choose iOS Bundle Signing under Build, and select the corresponding Identity and Provisioning profile you had just set up for this project.
trans-unit.target: Choose iOS Bundle Signing under Build, and select the corresponding Identity and Provisioning profile you had just set up for this project.

trans-unit.source: This ensures that the Xamarin project uses the new profile for code signing.
trans-unit.target: This ensures that the Xamarin project uses the new profile for code signing.

trans-unit.source: For the official Xamarin device provisioning documentation, see [Xamarin Device Provisioning].
trans-unit.target: For the official Xamarin device provisioning documentation, see [Xamarin Device Provisioning].

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Add push notifications to your app
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Add push notifications to your app

trans-unit.source: In Xamarin.Studio or Visual Studio, expand the ToDoAzure.iOS project, open the AppDelegate class, and then replace the FinishedLaunching event with the following code:
trans-unit.target: In Xamarin.Studio or Visual Studio, expand the ToDoAzure.iOS project, open the AppDelegate class, and then replace the FinishedLaunching event with the following code:

trans-unit.source: In AppDelegate, override the RegisteredForRemoteNotifications event:
trans-unit.target: In AppDelegate, override the RegisteredForRemoteNotifications event:

trans-unit.source: In AppDelegate, override the ReceivedRemoteNotification event:
trans-unit.target: In AppDelegate, override the ReceivedRemoteNotification event:

trans-unit.source: Your app is now updated to support push notifications.
trans-unit.target: Your app is now updated to support push notifications.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Update the registered insert script in the Management Portal
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Update the registered insert script in the Management Portal

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, click the Data tab and then click the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, click the Data tab and then click the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: In todoitem, click the Script tab and select Insert.
trans-unit.target: In todoitem, click the Script tab and select Insert.

trans-unit.source: This displays the function that is invoked when an insert occurs in the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: This displays the function that is invoked when an insert occurs in the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: Replace the insert function with the following code, and then click Save:
trans-unit.target: Replace the insert function with the following code, and then click Save:

trans-unit.source: This registers a new insert script, which sends a push notification (the inserted text) to the device provided in the insert request.
trans-unit.target: This registers a new insert script, which sends a push notification (the inserted text) to the device provided in the insert request.

trans-unit.source: This script delays sending the notification to give you time to close the app to receive a toast notification.
trans-unit.target: This script delays sending the notification to give you time to close the app to receive a toast notification.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Test push notifications in your app
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Test push notifications in your app

trans-unit.source: Press the Run button to build the project and start the app in an iOS capable device, then click OK to accept push notifications
trans-unit.target: Press the Run button to build the project and start the app in an iOS capable device, then click OK to accept push notifications

trans-unit.source: You must explicitly accept push notifications from your app.
trans-unit.target: You must explicitly accept push notifications from your app.

trans-unit.source: This request only occurs the first time that the app runs.
trans-unit.target: This request only occurs the first time that the app runs.

trans-unit.source: In the app, click the Add button, add a task title and then click the Save button.
trans-unit.target: In the app, click the Add button, add a task title and then click the Save button.

trans-unit.source: Verify that a notification is received, then click OK to dismiss the notification.
trans-unit.target: Verify that a notification is received, then click OK to dismiss the notification.

trans-unit.source: You have successfully completed this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You have successfully completed this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Add push notifications to the Xamarin.Forms.Android app
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Add push notifications to the Xamarin.Forms.Android app

trans-unit.source: You'll add push notifications to the Android app by using the Google Cloud Messaging (GCM) service.
trans-unit.target: You'll add push notifications to the Android app by using the Google Cloud Messaging (GCM) service.

trans-unit.source: You'll need an active Google account, and the [Google Cloud Messaging Client Component].
trans-unit.target: You'll need an active Google account, and the [Google Cloud Messaging Client Component].

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Enable Google Cloud Messaging
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Enable Google Cloud Messaging

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Configure your mobile service to send push requests
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Configure your mobile service to send push requests

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Update the registered insert script to send notifications
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Update the registered insert script to send notifications

trans-unit.source: The following steps show you how to update the script registered to the insert operation on the TodoItem table in the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: The following steps show you how to update the script registered to the insert operation on the TodoItem table in the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: You can also access and edit this mobile service script directly in Visual Studio, in the Azure node of Server Explorer.
trans-unit.target: You can also access and edit this mobile service script directly in Visual Studio, in the Azure node of Server Explorer.

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, click the Data tab and then click the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, click the Data tab and then click the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: In todoitem, click the Script tab and select Insert.
trans-unit.target: In todoitem, click the Script tab and select Insert.

trans-unit.source: This displays the function that is invoked when an insert occurs in the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: This displays the function that is invoked when an insert occurs in the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: Replace the insert function with the following code, and then click Save:
trans-unit.target: Replace the insert function with the following code, and then click Save:

trans-unit.source: This registers a new insert script, which sends a push notification (the inserted text) to the device provided in the insert request.
trans-unit.target: This registers a new insert script, which sends a push notification (the inserted text) to the device provided in the insert request.

trans-unit.source: This script delays sending the notification to give you time to close the app to receive a toast notification.
trans-unit.target: This script delays sending the notification to give you time to close the app to receive a toast notification.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Configure the existing project for push notifications
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Configure the existing project for push notifications

trans-unit.source: In the Solution view, expand the Components folder in the Xamarin.Android app and make sure that Azure Mobile Services package is installed.
trans-unit.target: In the Solution view, expand the Components folder in the Xamarin.Android app and make sure that Azure Mobile Services package is installed.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the Components folder, click Get More Components..., search for the Google Cloud Messaging Client component and add it to the project.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the Components folder, click Get More Components..., search for the Google Cloud Messaging Client component and add it to the project.

trans-unit.source: Open the MainActivity.cs project file and add the following using statement to the class:
trans-unit.target: Open the MainActivity.cs project file and add the following using statement to the class:

trans-unit.source: In the MainActivity class, add the following code to the OnCreate method, after the call to the LoadApplication method:
trans-unit.target: In the MainActivity class, add the following code to the OnCreate method, after the call to the LoadApplication method:

trans-unit.source: Your MainActivity is now prepared for adding push notifications.
trans-unit.target: Your MainActivity is now prepared for adding push notifications.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Add push notifications code to your app
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Add push notifications code to your app

trans-unit.source: In the ToDoAzure.Droid project, create a new class in the project called GcmService.
trans-unit.target: In the ToDoAzure.Droid project, create a new class in the project called GcmService.

trans-unit.source: Add the following using statements to GcmService class:
trans-unit.target: Add the following using statements to GcmService class:

trans-unit.target: Add the following permission requests between the using statements and the namespace declaration:

trans-unit.source: In the GcmService.cs project file, add the following class:
trans-unit.target: In the GcmService.cs project file, add the following class:

trans-unit.source: In the above code, you must replace __ with the project number assigned by Google when you provisioned your app in the Google developer portal.
trans-unit.target: In the above code, you must replace __ with the project number assigned by Google when you provisioned your app in the Google developer portal.

trans-unit.source: In the GcmService.cs project file, add the following code that defines the GcmService class:
trans-unit.target: In the GcmService.cs project file, add the following code that defines the GcmService class:

trans-unit.source: Note that this class derives from GcmServiceBase and that the Service attribute must be applied to this class.
trans-unit.target: Note that this class derives from GcmServiceBase and that the Service attribute must be applied to this class.

trans-unit.source: The GcmServiceBase class implements the OnRegistered(), OnUnRegistered(), OnMessage() and OnError() methods.
trans-unit.target: The GcmServiceBase class implements the OnRegistered(), OnUnRegistered(), OnMessage() and OnError() methods.

trans-unit.source: You must override these methods in the GcmService class.
trans-unit.target: You must override these methods in the GcmService class.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code to the GcmService class that overrides the OnRegistered event handler.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code to the GcmService class that overrides the OnRegistered event handler.

trans-unit.source: This method uses the returned GCM registration ID to register with Azure for push notifications.
trans-unit.target: This method uses the returned GCM registration ID to register with Azure for push notifications.

trans-unit.source: Override the OnMessage method in GcmService with the following code:
trans-unit.target: Override the OnMessage method in GcmService with the following code:

trans-unit.source: Add the following method overrides for OnUnRegistered() and OnError(), which are required for the project to compile.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Test push notifications in your app
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Test push notifications in your app

trans-unit.source: You can test the app by directly attaching an Android phone with a USB cable, or by using a virtual device in the emulator.
trans-unit.target: You can test the app by directly attaching an Android phone with a USB cable, or by using a virtual device in the emulator.

trans-unit.source: When you run this app in the emulator, make sure that you use an Android Virtual Device (AVD) that supports Google APIs.
trans-unit.target: When you run this app in the emulator, make sure that you use an Android Virtual Device (AVD) that supports Google APIs.

trans-unit.source: In order to receive push notifications, you must set up a Google account on your Android Virtual Device (in the emulator, navigate to Settings and click Add Account).
trans-unit.target: In order to receive push notifications, you must set up a Google account on your Android Virtual Device (in the emulator, navigate to Settings and click Add Account).

trans-unit.source: Also, make sure that the emulator is connected to the Internet.
trans-unit.target: Also, make sure that the emulator is connected to the Internet.

trans-unit.source: From Tools, click Open Android Emulator Manager, select your device, and then click Edit.
trans-unit.target: From Tools, click Open Android Emulator Manager, select your device, and then click Edit.

trans-unit.source: Select Google APIs in Target, then click OK.
trans-unit.target: Select Google APIs in Target, then click OK.

trans-unit.source: On the top toolbar, click Run, and then select your app.
trans-unit.target: On the top toolbar, click Run, and then select your app.

trans-unit.source: This starts the emulator and runs the app.
trans-unit.target: This starts the emulator and runs the app.

trans-unit.source: The app retrieves the registrationId from GCM and registers with the Notification Hub.
trans-unit.target: The app retrieves the registrationId from GCM and registers with the Notification Hub.

trans-unit.source: In the app, add a new task.
trans-unit.target: In the app, add a new task.

trans-unit.source: Swipe down from the top of the screen to open the device's Notification Center to see the notification.
trans-unit.target: Swipe down from the top of the screen to open the device's Notification Center to see the notification.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Add push notifications to the Xamarin.Forms.Windows app
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Add push notifications to the Xamarin.Forms.Windows app

trans-unit.source: This section shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services to send push notifications to the Windows Phone Silverlight app that is included in your Xamarin.Forms solution.
trans-unit.target: This section shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services to send push notifications to the Windows Phone Silverlight app that is included in your Xamarin.Forms solution.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> Update the app to register for notifications
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> Update the app to register for notifications

trans-unit.source: Before your app can receive push notifications, you must register a notification channel.
trans-unit.target: Before your app can receive push notifications, you must register a notification channel.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open the file App.xaml.cs and add the following using statement:
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open the file App.xaml.cs and add the following using statement:

trans-unit.source: Add the following to App.xaml.cs:
trans-unit.target: Add the following to App.xaml.cs:

trans-unit.source: This code retrieves the ChannelURI for the app from the Microsoft Push Notification Service (MPNS) used by Windows Phone 8.x "Silverlight", and then registers that ChannelURI for push notifications.
trans-unit.target: This code retrieves the ChannelURI for the app from the Microsoft Push Notification Service (MPNS) used by Windows Phone 8.x "Silverlight", and then registers that ChannelURI for push notifications.

trans-unit.source: In this this tutorial, the mobile service sends a toast notification to the device.
trans-unit.target: In this this tutorial, the mobile service sends a toast notification to the device.

trans-unit.source: When you send a tile notification, you must instead call the BindToShellTile method on the channel.
trans-unit.target: When you send a tile notification, you must instead call the BindToShellTile method on the channel.

trans-unit.source: At the top of the Application_Launching event handler in App.xaml.cs, add the following call to the new AcquirePushChannel method:
trans-unit.target: At the top of the Application_Launching event handler in App.xaml.cs, add the following call to the new AcquirePushChannel method:

trans-unit.source: This makes sure that registration is requested every time that the page is loaded.
trans-unit.target: This makes sure that registration is requested every time that the page is loaded.

trans-unit.source: In your app, you may only want to make this registration periodically to ensure that the registration is current.
trans-unit.target: In your app, you may only want to make this registration periodically to ensure that the registration is current.

trans-unit.source: Press the F5 key to run the app.
trans-unit.target: Press the F5 key to run the app.

trans-unit.source: A popup dialog with the registration key is displayed.
trans-unit.target: A popup dialog with the registration key is displayed.

trans-unit.source: In the Solution Explorer, expand Properties, open the WMAppManifest.xml file, click the Capabilities tab and make sure that the ID___CAP___PUSH_NOTIFICATION capability is checked.
trans-unit.target: In the Solution Explorer, expand Properties, open the WMAppManifest.xml file, click the Capabilities tab and make sure that the ID___CAP___PUSH_NOTIFICATION capability is checked.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Enable notifications in VS</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Enable notifications in VS</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This makes sure that your app can raise toast notifications.
trans-unit.target: This makes sure that your app can raise toast notifications.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> Update server scripts to send push notifications
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> Update server scripts to send push notifications

trans-unit.source: Finally, you must update the script registered to the insert operation on the TodoItem table to send notifications.
trans-unit.target: Finally, you must update the script registered to the insert operation on the TodoItem table to send notifications.

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, click the Data tab and then click the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, click the Data tab and then click the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: In todoitem, click the Script tab and select Insert.
trans-unit.target: In todoitem, click the Script tab and select Insert.

trans-unit.source: This displays the function that is invoked when an insert occurs in the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: This displays the function that is invoked when an insert occurs in the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: Replace the insert function with the following code, and then click Save:
trans-unit.target: Replace the insert function with the following code, and then click Save:

trans-unit.source: This registers a new insert script, which sends a push notification (the inserted text) to the device provided in the insert request.
trans-unit.target: This registers a new insert script, which sends a push notification (the inserted text) to the device provided in the insert request.

trans-unit.source: Click the Push tab, check Enable unauthenticated push notifications, then click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click the Push tab, check Enable unauthenticated push notifications, then click Save.

trans-unit.source: This enables the mobile service to connect to MPNS in unauthenticated mode to send push notifications.
trans-unit.target: This enables the mobile service to connect to MPNS in unauthenticated mode to send push notifications.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial uses MPNS in unauthenticated mode.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial uses MPNS in unauthenticated mode.

trans-unit.source: In this mode, MPNS limits the number of notifications that can be sent to a device channel.
trans-unit.target: In this mode, MPNS limits the number of notifications that can be sent to a device channel.

trans-unit.source: To remove this restriction, you must generate and upload a certificate by clicking Upload and selecting the certificate.
trans-unit.target: To remove this restriction, you must generate and upload a certificate by clicking Upload and selecting the certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more information on generating the certificate, see [Setting up an authenticated web service to send push notifications for Windows Phone].
trans-unit.target: For more information on generating the certificate, see [Setting up an authenticated web service to send push notifications for Windows Phone].

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> Test push notifications in your app
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> Test push notifications in your app

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, press the F5 key to run the app.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, press the F5 key to run the app.

trans-unit.source: You may encounter a 401 Unauthorized RegistrationAuthorizationException when testing on the Windows Phone emulator.
trans-unit.target: You may encounter a 401 Unauthorized RegistrationAuthorizationException when testing on the Windows Phone emulator.

trans-unit.source: This can occur during the RegisterNativeAsync() call because of the way the Windows Phone emulator syncs it's clock with the host PC.
trans-unit.target: This can occur during the RegisterNativeAsync() call because of the way the Windows Phone emulator syncs it's clock with the host PC.

trans-unit.source: It can result in a security token that will be rejected.
trans-unit.target: It can result in a security token that will be rejected.

trans-unit.source: To resolve this simply manually set the clock in the emulator before testing.
trans-unit.target: To resolve this simply manually set the clock in the emulator before testing.

trans-unit.source: In the app, create a new task with the title Hello push, then immediately click the start button or back button to leave the app.
trans-unit.target: In the app, create a new task with the title Hello push, then immediately click the start button or back button to leave the app.

trans-unit.source: This sends an insert request to the mobile service to store the added item.
trans-unit.target: This sends an insert request to the mobile service to store the added item.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the device receives a toast notification that says hello push.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the device receives a toast notification that says hello push.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Toast notification received</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Toast notification received</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You will not receive the notification when you are still in the app.
trans-unit.target: You will not receive the notification when you are still in the app.

trans-unit.source: To receive a toast notification while the app is active, you must handle the <link><linkText>ShellToastNotificationReceived</linkText><title></title></link> event.
trans-unit.target: To receive a toast notification while the app is active, you must handle the <link><linkText>ShellToastNotificationReceived</linkText><title></title></link> event.
